body:
@gemmellr yep, saw that. Def related to your points above. I’m cleaning that up first thing this morning.

UPDATE: Change is in for deliveryTime http unit tests passed locally (including the foreign message test). Pending Jenkins CI job to go 'green'
Still seeing a bunch of log4j 1.x deps, less than before but still several. Same number of slf4j-log4j12 deps.
@gemmellr most of them are coming from commons-logging dependency in activeio. Should I exclude it ?

I would say so, if the idea is to not use Log4J 1.x, then there should be no trace of it. Those bits should be using Log4J 2 (via the 1.2 bridge), or a less apealling alternative would be subbing in reload4j, but that doesnt really make sense given the context.
Alright, I add the exclude.
Guys can you take a look at this. This issue requires a server restart from time to time to avoid an application OOM.

Thanks for the PR, this looks like a good catch. A couple things: Pull requests should have a Jira associated with it describing the issue. https://issues.apache.org/jira/projects/AMQ . Also, ideally it would be good to include a unit test that can demonstrate the issue and show that it's fixed.

In this case I'll create the Jira as I am going to re-work the fix slightly by adding a test real quick because we are about to do a new release but for the future you can keep that in mind.

Seems like this issue is due to: [AMQ-7085](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/AMQ-7085)
Thanks a lot @cshannon. Good point on the testing part... I didn't include the test because I didn't find any test for that class.
@cesarhernandezgt do you mind to amend your commit to use jackson instead of jacksong (and force push) ?
@gemmellr PR updated

> Still some remaining log4j 1 instances (from zookeeper and pax stuff, as on the reload4j PR):

 This much should be expected given it was one of the main things in the reload4j PR, e.g https://github.com/apache/activemq/commit/1f01a61426e1f783b0952bb4298c6aeeaa1e5011#diff-9c5fb3d1b7e3b0f54bc5c4182965c4fe1f9023d449017cece3005d3f90e8e4d8R623-R656 and https://github.com/apache/activemq/commit/1f01a61426e1f783b0952bb4298c6aeeaa1e5011#diff-9c5fb3d1b7e3b0f54bc5c4182965c4fe1f9023d449017cece3005d3f90e8e4d8R491-R512

A likely difference in this case might be the addition of the log4j2 bridge for the 1.2 api.
@gemmellr let me double check, I thought I did it already.
Easy to check with a little grep :)

Grrr.. fighting with one test that passes-locally-fails-on-apache-ci. 

The test totally looks like it could be something that was impacted by the changes in the PR, but the exception stack doesn't align

Test: activemq-amqp/JMSInteroperabilityTest.testQpidToOpenWireObjectMessage
```
javax.jms.JMSException: Failed to build body from content. Serializable class not available to broker. Reason: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: Forbidden class java.util.UUID! This class is not trusted to be serialized as ObjectMessage payload. Please take a look at http://activemq.apache.org/objectmessage.html for more information on how to configure trusted classes.
	at org.apache.activemq.transport.amqp.JMSInteroperabilityTest.testQpidToOpenWireObjectMessage(JMSInteroperabilityTest.java:402)
Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: Forbidden class java.util.UUID! This class is not trusted to be serialized as ObjectMessage payload. Please take a look at http://activemq.apache.org/objectmessage.html for more information on how to configure trusted classes.
	at org.apache.activemq.transport.amqp.JMSInteroperabilityTest.testQpidToOpenWireObjectMessage(JMSInteroperabilityTest.java:402)
```
@mattrpav it seems related to security enforcement we added. But it should fail on your machine as well.

> @mattrpav it seems related to security enforcement we added. But it should fail on your machine as well.

I agree with you =)

The connection factory is setup without setting trusted packages:
AmqpTestSupport#createJMSConnection()
```
        ActiveMQConnectionFactory factory = new ActiveMQConnectionFactory(openwireURI);
        return factory.createConnection();
```

.. which defaults to
ClassLoadingAwareObjectInputStream#static{}
```
serializablePackages = System.getProperty("org.apache.activemq.SERIALIZABLE_PACKAGES","java.lang,org.apache.activemq,org.fusesource.hawtbuf,com.thoughtworks.xstream.mapper").split(",");
```
.. but should be overidden by
AmqpTestSupport#setUp
```
        System.setProperty("org.apache.activemq.SERIALIZABLE_PACKAGES", "java.util");
```

Hmm.. that could be an order of operations problem. I'm going to change the test to add 'java.util' to the list when it instantiates the connection factory.
No log4j1 dep anymore
I don't see log4j1 anymore so that part looks good
Yep, no log4j 1 and no slf4j-log4j12 mentions now. The mentions of log4j look to all be 2.17.1 now.
@cesarhernandezgt nevermind, I will do the amend myself. Thanks !
I think this is ready to merge at this point if the tests pass (i don't think i see any other changes)

The value set by the property in ClassLoadingAwareObjectInputStream is a static, so updating it doesnt do anything if already set when the codepath has been first used. So the first test to use that codepath will lock the value down. If a test sets the value itself before it is ever used, then running that test in isolation will always work. If another test is run before it in the same suite in the same JVM and exercises that codepath first with a mismatched value, the subsequent tests setter will have no effect on what actually happens, and the test will fail.
Think it needs a rebase after the recent force push on main. The Jenkins build fell over, and prodding a restart it doesnt like trying to merge it.
Rebased
AH, I somehow missed the last line of your previous message :)
That amqp test fix worked. I'm going to break it out into a separate PR for consideration into 5.17.0
Last change breaks some tests, I'm fixing (probably due to dependency updates). I'm on it.
All should be good now. I'm just waiting for Jenkins green light before merging.
The latest Ant is 1.10.12, this seems silly. 1.6.5 is almost 17 years old.
This also doesnt seem much better, Groovy 4.0.0 just came out.
1.6.5 includes latest CVE. But you are right, let me try ant 1.10.12, it should work out of the box.
1.8.1 is used elsewhere in the build. Probably makes sense to manage the version.
There are loads of CVE fixes in the later streams if thats why you are doing it: https://ant.apache.org/security.html
The purpose is just to include CVE fixed minot version. I can jump to "bigger" version.
@gemmellr good point, let me update Jira and this PR.

Head before the change, note that the older one this changed is also in a different groupId which should also be updated:
```
$ mvn dependency:tree | grep "ant:ant"
[INFO] \- ant:ant:jar:1.6.2:compile
[INFO] |     \- org.apache.ant:ant:jar:1.8.1:provided
[INFO] |        \- org.apache.ant:ant-launcher:jar:1.8.1:provided
[INFO] |     \- org.apache.ant:ant:jar:1.8.1:compile
[INFO] |        \- org.apache.ant:ant-launcher:jar:1.8.1:compile
[INFO] |  |     \- org.apache.ant:ant:jar:1.8.1:compile
[INFO] |  |        \- org.apache.ant:ant-launcher:jar:1.8.1:compile
[INFO] |     \- org.apache.ant:ant:jar:1.8.1:compile
[INFO] |        \- org.apache.ant:ant-launcher:jar:1.8.1:compile
```

That would have made perfect sense at the time (these also look around 17 years old), but entirely weird now given all the issues it would still contain that were fixed in later releases. 04 isnt even the latest version of that stream, it seems 06 is, though that one doesnt look to have a pom. Seems like the 1.x stream proper also came later, nevermind the other minors and majors after that.
I would just wait on stuff like this (ant, groovy,etc) and freeze the release. We can target upgrades on these dependencies to the latest versions (like groovy 3 or 4) for 2.17.1 or 2.18.
Yep it certainly does seem like it could wait until after 5.17.0, having done for so very long already.
@jbonofre - We all good to merge?Looks like the checks passed

@cshannon please give this a look over, it'd be good to get it into 5.17.0. This fix addresses the use case that originally sparked the improvement-- failover with a message that server-side maxFrameSize check failing results in infinite retries.

@mattrpav - Nice catch, this is definitely an issue with the exception type and this seems like the right fix. Thanks for updating the tests, they look good. We definitely don't want to be attempting to reconnect on this failure as it would never work so it needs to be propagated back up.
As long as the CI tests pass I think this is good to merge

First round of tests passed clean. I pushed an update of change that included comments in the test w/ link to the jira about how client check=false + failover + server check=true is an infinite retry.

I'll merge once the next round of tests goes green.

Thanks!

Ok, I pushed an update and went through and removed what I think was all the stuff the revert added back in that shouldn't be there. I guess the main thing is to make sure OSGi is ok with the geronimo jar vs the jakarta jar that got reverted
I restarted CI with the new commit
This is what I have so far but is still broken as there is a lot of Log4j specific stuff that won't compile so need to decide how to fix the tests

There's a ton of places where log4j is used directly and is breaking everything. @mattrpav is taking a look now with a follow on PR to fix it. We can merge this plus the follow on PR and sort out the tree when ready.

We should also update CI to run this project as well. For PRs we could activate the smoke tests or quick tests only etc. We could also set up a daily job and run a couple other profiles such as the ctivemq.exclude-broken-tests which should run a lot more tests but take longer.

Agree with @jbonofre, I think having a configuration option makes no sense. ~~Just change it but at this point it should be target for 5.18 as 5.17 should be frozen except for critical stuff~~ I think we can include it in 5.17.0 since it's just logging if you want to but in my opinion it should have the toggle/flag option removed as discussed on the dev list thread.
Anyone have any objections before I merge this in? Seems like it's good to merge.
Looks good, you fixed the only bits that seemed of note.
Seems like the build is failing because it's already searching for 5.18.0 after the rebase?

The build is broken due to 5.18.0 been broken in main (the version was bumped today). There's an issue with the maven build that caused it to not build all the modules and some changes were missed that are being worked on: See #787 

Also as discussed on the dev list this is going into 5.18.0 anyways if after discussion everyone is still in agreement on the terms going forward
Testing the PR now.
I'm looking now, we can probably merge my PR first and then rebase and merge in this one to keep the tree clean
I'm getting compilation failures still when using this commit on top of my other PR and building

Still lots of classes broken:

AMQ4221Test, AMQ4221Test, AMQ4221Test, AMQ3567Test, AMQ1936Test, AMQ3779Test, Log4JConfigTest.java

And that's just some of them, there's a lot more
@cshannon yep. this is WIP
@mattrpav - I merged #787 so you can rebase off of that. Once we are happy with this PR and things are fixed we can cherry-pick the commits to 2.17.x and continue with the release
Retesting this PR.

It's not letting me push an update to this branch but I fixed two tests with this commit: https://github.com/cshannon/activemq/commit/766743deb1e1b644f29b34f04e15e4741834f22e

This commit fixes AMQ6446Test and JmxAuditLogTest
I pushed up my commit and marked off tests that pass for me on command line so far, still looking at others
This PR will need to be rebased on #789 when complete.
LGTM

I think we can probably merge this (either just keep both commits or squash, i don't care). Then we need to decide on a profile to run for CI by default and merge stuff into 2.17.x. Last thing would be to set up a daily job to run all tests
@cshannon agreed. Let's merge and see how it runs on Apache CI and fix up any tests from there.
@jbonofre - you should be able to rebase this now against main and let the tests run
@mattrpav - We can let this run and see how long it takes
Thanks for the PR, this seems reasonable to me, would you be able to create a Jira for this and include the Jira number in the commit to track the change? https://issues.apache.org/jira/projects/AMQ

Looks like this was changed here: https://github.com/apache/activemq/commit/a767bda603119387af8e8ce06af268470fe33c3a

The Xms change made sense (going lower) but obviously dropping that If statement is an issue. So been broken for a while but we should change it back to allow overriding.
Sounds good, you can go ahead and merge it if you want
Created a PR so tests can run.  We can merge into main and cherry-pick into 5.17.x if the next CI run shows the failures for the test are gone
i'm closing this and opened a new PR: https://github.com/apache/activemq/pull/795
@jbonofre  and @mattrpav - This is a work in progress, I'm going to make more changes and push them up. I'll let you guys know when I'm done.

@jbonofre and @mattrpav - Ok I'm all finished, we are good to go to keep going with 5.17.0. There's nothing here that justifies cancelling the vote. There are a couple issues to fix later (notably the JMS 2.0 broken tests in main) and some other flaky tests but nothing that's a real regression.
I figure we can merge this into main after CI runs and then backport to 5.17.x for 5.17.1 plus continue on with some of my comments to fix the flaky tests, jms 2.0 issues and genonimo annotation jar.

Note I just fixed the JMS 2.0 failures here : https://github.com/apache/activemq/commit/957a2dd9408d22328829a04ce1780406dc7600e4

It was a trivial fix so I just pushed the commit to main
This fixes MessageDestinationVirtualTopicTest as well as any other tests that might use `@Resource` for autowiring

my mistake. sorry

@cshannon thx !
Closing stale PR
What is the purpose of this change? Is there an associated JIRA?
I agree with @lucastetreault. Can you provide some context and purpose ? I don't see strong arguments to change encoding there.

@lucastetreault @jbonofre My instance ActiveMQ has non-ISO-8859-1 queues names.

ISO-8859-1:
```xml
<queues>
    <queue name="?? ? ??">
        <stats size="0" consumerCount="0" enqueueCount="0" dequeueCount="0" />
        <feed>
            <atom>queueBrowse/?? ? ???view=rss&feedType=atom_1.0</atom>
            <rss>queueBrowse/?? ? ???view=rss&feedType=rss_2.0</rss>
        </feed>
    </queue>
    <queue name="??????, ???!">
        <stats size="0" consumerCount="0" enqueueCount="0" dequeueCount="0" />
        <feed>
            <atom>queueBrowse/??????, ???!?view=rss&feedType=atom_1.0</atom>
            <rss>queueBrowse/??????, ???!?view=rss&feedType=rss_2.0</rss>
        </feed>
    </queue>
</queues>
```

UTF-8:
```xml
<queues>
    <queue name="🐶 → 🐈">
        <stats size="0" consumerCount="0" enqueueCount="0" dequeueCount="0" />
        <feed>
            <atom>queueBrowse/🐶 → 🐈?view=rss&feedType=atom_1.0</atom>
            <rss>queueBrowse/🐶 → 🐈?view=rss&feedType=rss_2.0</rss>
        </feed>
    </queue>
    <queue name="Привет, Мир!">
        <stats size="0" consumerCount="0" enqueueCount="0" dequeueCount="0" />
        <feed>
            <atom>queueBrowse/Привет, Мир!?view=rss&feedType=atom_1.0</atom>
            <rss>queueBrowse/Привет, Мир!?view=rss&feedType=rss_2.0</rss>
        </feed>
    </queue>
</queues>
```
I tested on a 5.16.3 broker on Amazon MQ: And a vanilla 5.17.0 broker on my laptop to be sure: There doesn't seem to be any problems with the two examples you provided.
@lucastetreault Click in «Queue Views» button «XML»
Ah thanks for the clarification. I see the issue now:

You can also hot-replace files while ActiveMQ is running and the issue will be gone.

```bash
sed -i s/ISO-8859-1/UTF-8/g /opt/activemq/webapps/admin/xml/*.jsp
```

Where `/opt/activemq/` — path to ActiveMQ app.

I think this is a super interesting feature even if it doesn't end up getting merged. Thanks for submitting this @maxfortun!

I don't see a space for "community plugins" on the ActiveMQ website but I think it would be great to start compiling a list of unofficial plugins similar to Rabbit MQ for example: https://www.rabbitmq.com/community-plugins.html.
Not sure about this one as it's based on leveldb which is removed now. I would rather focus on redis and bookkeeper store similar to kahadb.

> Not sure about this one as it's based on leveldb which is removed now. I would rather focus on redis and bookkeeper store similar to kahadb.

@jbonofre, I think the references to leveldb are just because of the branch or commit this was based on which still included leveldb. There doesn't seem to be any usage of leveldb at all in this redis store implementation.
